    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class TradeDetailActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
    This activity handles viewing trade details, and accepting/declining trades.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  TradeDetailActivity.EmailThread
      E-mails both the owner and borrower with trade details and the owner's comments.

        requestCode - request code for the sender that will be associated with the result data when it is returned

      • accept

        public void accept(android.view.View view)
        Called when the user presses the "Accept Trade" button.

        This method is used to set the trade as "accepted" and call a dialog to enter a comment.

        Parameters:
        view - "Accept Trade" button

      • decline

        public void decline(android.view.View view)
        Called when the user presses the "Decline Trade" button.

        This method is used to set the trade as "declined" and call a prompt dialog asking if the owner wants to make a counter trade.

        Parameters:
        view - "Decline Trade" button

      • complete

        public void complete(android.view.View view)
        Called when the owner presses the "Complete Trade" button.

        This method is to set the trade to complete for both the owner and borrower once the items have been traded and the owner chooses to set the trade to complete.

        Parameters:
        view - "Complete Trade" button

      • decodeImage

        public android.graphics.Bitmap decodeImage(java.lang.String encoded)
        Decodes the encoded string into an image and returns it. Code taken from: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4837110/how-to-convert-a-base64-string-into-a-bitmap-image-to-show-it-in-a-imageview (C) 2011 user432209
        Parameters:
        encoded - encoded image in string format
        Returns:
        decodedByte decoded image in Bitmap format
